stories.text:
Hey HN! Abboud Chaballout here - founder of Diagnoss - where we aim to free medical providers from the mundane.

One of the tools we built reads clinicians' notes in real-time, as they are charting, to tee up diagnoses they can use for documentation purposes. You can try it here: (https://demo.diagnoss.com/) without downloading anything.

The current workflow of doctors today requires them to (1) type out a patient encounter (e.g. "patient presents with chest pain") and then (2) use a search bar in their electronic health record system to search and add the chest pain diagnosis code R07.9. If a clinician needs to document 10 different diagnoses, they are going to have to do this second step 10 different times.

With Diagnoss, diagnoses needed for documentation are teed up autonomously, so clinicians end up saving time.

If you are curious to see how it works when it is fully integrated into a clinician's EHR, let me know and I would be happy to share more. Either way, please feel free to share your feedback and/or thoughts on supporting medical providers with value-add tools below.
stories.title: Show HN: Real-time Diagnosis Code Suggestions while typing a medical encounter
